title: Life Science - Senior Scheduler - Remote
description: Company DescriptionAt Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.Every day we help our major global clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects in over 108 offices in 45 countries worldwide.Our team is dynamic, innovative and client-focused. Our clients value our proactive approach, depth of expertise, integrity and the quality we deliver. As a result our people get to work on some of the most exciting projects in the world.Job DescriptionWe are seeking an experienced Life Science Project Planner / Scheduler. Ideal candidate will have excellent leadership and working experience in the pharmaceutical and/or high-tech manufacturing industry (strong preference toward candidates with biotech/pharma experience)As a Life Science Project Planner/Scheduler with Turner & Townsend you will support our clients by developing and defining their project goals and objectives, and creating master plans that include timelines, required resources, the order of needed tasks, and the responsibilities of each project team member. You are the face of our company and as such must represent our company well by being professional and motivated to exceed client expectations.Develop, monitor, and update integrated project plans and schedules so that projects can be executed in the most efficient manner possibleInterface with project stakeholders as a trusted advisor to provide guidance and recommendations for the projectPrepare baseline schedules and schedule basis documents for approval by project teamsAssess impacts to the critical path and near-critical activities and report to the project teamMonitor schedule deviations and variances and assist in the developing of alternative methods for corrective actionPrepare and provide schedule progress reports, trending charts, and schedule analysis on a periodic basisMaintain a record of scope changes, trends, and variances that potentially affect schedule performanceAssure credibility of the information contained in the scheduleReview schedules with project team members on a regular basis to ensure that accurate and timely data is incorporated in the scheduleQualificationsBachelor’s degree (preferably Engineering, Architecture, Construction Management, or related field)4-8 years as a planner/scheduler in the biotech/pharma industryExpertise using Primavera P6 Experience within life sciences experience is a MUST.Must possess exemplary communication skills - both oral and writtenAdditional InformationTurner & Townsend is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. principles.Ability to calculate complex figures.Ability to forecast and prepare budgets.Conducts financial/business analysis including the preparation of reports.Ability to solve advanced problems and title: Director, Clean Energy & Transmission
description: Company DescriptionTurner & Townsend’s is a global consultancy with over 11,000 employees operating in 125 offices across 48 countries. Turner & Townsend is located throughout the United States where we support clients across all Real Estate, Natural Resources and Infrastructure.Our Purpose is making the difference: transforming performance for a green, inclusive, and productive world. This Purpose is grounded in the belief that we work in an industry that has the potential to transform lives, whether by helping to tackle the climate agenda or levelling up society through improved infrastructure.We specialize in major programs, program management, cost and commercial management, net zero and digital solutions. We support projects throughout the whole lifecycle.Job DescriptionOur global Clean Energy team works across renewables, energy transmission, carbon capture and nuclear power. Our ambition is to be the catalyst for the world’s energy transition.Due to the continued success and expansion of the Clean Energy & Decarbonisation business, we are interested in speaking with a Senior Consultant with a proven background in delivering projects and programs in the clean energy sector.Requirements:Experience and credibility in the electricity sector with an existing knowledge of Transmission & Distribution and Renewables. Experience in the development and delivery of Carbon Capture schemes is also desirable. You will have established relationships with, both national and international clients and understand the requirements for strategy, set-up and delivery of capital programs.Your track record will have seen you leading teams and providing advice on complex projects across electricity sector. Technical understanding of Project Management, Commercial Management and Project Controls.Candidates should expect, and be able to, travel throughout the US, to support the growth of our Clean Energy activity. Key Objectives:Working with our global leadership and in country teams determine and implement a sector strategy. Increase market share and influence, within the Transmission and Clean Energy sector in the US. Develop and secure relationships with key clients across the Transmission and Clean Energy sectors. Build and lead a team – including responsibility for P&L. Enable and achieve financial targets and continued growth within target markets. To ensure that the Clean Energy team in the US is effectively structured, engaged and led. Key Requirements Of The Role:To be an inspirational leader and strategic thinker. To build strong relationships with clients and cross-functional team members.To build teams To secure business development opportunities with existing and new clients, including cross-selling opportunities, and to generate new business to achieve the Vision 2025 goal for the US, and specifically the Clean Energy sector. To lead pursuits and tenders – developing compelling propositions for the delivery of outcomes that drive improved performance To assure the delivery of our teams in Clean Energy To be part of our global Clean Energy team – a conduit for learning and sharing information in the business Set ambitious targets for Clean Energy in the US. Effectively manage risks and maximize commercial returns, applying business acumen. Inspire people to give their best and to challenge the norm to find better ways to achieve, by valuing and nurturing the diverse skills and perspectives of our people. Lead by example and not be averse to being hands-on in creation and delivery. Act as a team player and be highly visible within the business. QualificationsProfile and key competencies:You will be self-motivated, driven by the goal of establishing Turner & Townsend as the #1 project management and commercial consultancy for Clean Energy in the US.  As a Director, you will also be responsible for developing and delivering on a business plan to meet ambitious annual growth targets.You Will Have:Extensive experience working as a client and/or consultant in development and delivery of clean energy, ideally in Transmission and/or Renewables Experience using and/or selling program management, project controls, cost and commercial management in Clean Energy A broad understanding of the electricity value chain from generation, through grid and into supply Good understanding of regulatory and permitting requirements and industry trends A proven track record in business development and building teams, ideally in consultancy An established network within the power industry supply chain Excellent communication skills, both oral and written The ability to guide and lead internal teams, offering a strong point of focus for the business. Operated as a consultant and delivered major capital programs Qualifications:Degree qualified in construction and/or engineering Professional memberships desirable. Additional InformationThe salary range for this full-time role is $185,000 - $260,000. Ranges are determined by role and level and represent a good faith effort to provide a fair and equitable salary. This range is a reflection of base salary only, not of a total compensation package.  Please note Turner & Townsend reserves the right to pay more or less than the posted range, depending on candidate’s experience and qualifications.Turner & Townsend is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Director, Clean Energy & Transmission
description: Company DescriptionTurner & Townsend’s is a global consultancy with over 11,000 employees operating in 125 offices across 48 countries. Turner & Townsend is located throughout the United States where we support clients across all Real Estate, Natural Resources and Infrastructure.Our Purpose is making the difference: transforming performance for a green, inclusive, and productive world. This Purpose is grounded in the belief that we work in an industry that has the potential to transform lives, whether by helping to tackle the climate agenda or levelling up society through improved infrastructure.We specialize in major programs, program management, cost and commercial management, net zero and digital solutions. We support projects throughout the whole lifecycle.Job DescriptionOur global Clean Energy team works across renewables, energy transmission, carbon capture and nuclear power. Our ambition is to be the catalyst for the world’s energy transition.Due to the continued success and expansion of the Clean Energy & Decarbonisation business, we are interested in speaking with a Senior Consultant with a proven background in delivering projects and programs in the clean energy sector.Requirements:Experience and credibility in the electricity sector with an existing knowledge of Transmission & Distribution and Renewables. Experience in the development and delivery of Carbon Capture schemes is also desirable. You will have established relationships with, both national and international clients and understand the requirements for strategy, set-up and delivery of capital programs.Your track record will have seen you leading teams and providing advice on complex projects across electricity sector. Technical understanding of Project Management, Commercial Management and Project Controls.Candidates should expect, and be able to, travel throughout the US, to support the growth of our Clean Energy activity. Key Objectives:Working with our global leadership and in country teams determine and implement a sector strategy. Increase market share and influence, within the Transmission and Clean Energy sector in the US. Develop and secure relationships with key clients across the Transmission and Clean Energy sectors. Build and lead a team – including responsibility for P&L. Enable and achieve financial targets and continued growth within target markets. To ensure that the Clean Energy team in the US is effectively structured, engaged and led. Key Requirements Of The Role:To be an inspirational leader and strategic thinker. To build strong relationships with clients and cross-functional team members.To build teams To secure business development opportunities with existing and new clients, including cross-selling opportunities, and to generate new business to achieve the Vision 2025 goal for the US, and specifically the Clean Energy sector. To lead pursuits and tenders – developing compelling propositions for the delivery of outcomes that drive improved performance To assure the delivery of our teams in Clean Energy To be part of our global Clean Energy team – a conduit for learning and sharing information in the business Set ambitious targets for Clean Energy in the US. Effectively manage risks and maximize commercial returns, applying business acumen. Inspire people to give their best and to challenge the norm to find better ways to achieve, by valuing and nurturing the diverse skills and perspectives of our people. Lead by example and not be averse to being hands-on in creation and delivery. Act as a team player and be highly visible within the business. QualificationsProfile and key competencies:You will be self-motivated, driven by the goal of establishing Turner & Townsend as the #1 project management and commercial consultancy for Clean Energy in the US.  As a Director, you will also be responsible for developing and delivering on a business plan to meet ambitious annual growth targets.You Will Have:Extensive experience working as a client and/or consultant in development and delivery of clean energy, ideally in Transmission and/or Renewables Experience using and/or selling program management, project controls, cost and commercial management in Clean Energy A broad understanding of the electricity value chain from generation, through grid and into supply Good understanding of regulatory and permitting requirements and industry trends A proven track record in business development and building teams, ideally in consultancy An established network within the power industry supply chain Excellent communication skills, both oral and written The ability to guide and lead internal teams, offering a strong point of focus for the business. title: Director, Clean Energy & Transmission
description: Company DescriptionTurner & Townsend’s is a global consultancy with over 11,000 employees operating in 125 offices across 48 countries. Turner & Townsend is located throughout the United States where we support clients across all Real Estate, Natural Resources and Infrastructure.Our Purpose is making the difference: transforming performance for a green, inclusive, and productive world. This Purpose is grounded in the belief that we work in an industry that has the potential to transform lives, whether by helping to tackle the climate agenda or levelling up society through improved infrastructure.We specialize in major programs, program management, cost and commercial management, net zero and digital solutions. We support projects throughout the whole lifecycle.Job DescriptionOur global Clean Energy team works across renewables, energy transmission, carbon capture and nuclear power. Our ambition is to be the catalyst for the world’s energy transition.Due to the continued success and expansion of the Clean Energy & Decarbonisation business, we are interested in speaking with a Senior Consultant with a proven background in delivering projects and programs in the clean energy sector.Requirements:Experience and credibility in the electricity sector with an existing knowledge of Transmission & Distribution and Renewables. Experience in the development and delivery of Carbon Capture schemes is also desirable. You will have established relationships with, both national and international clients and understand the requirements for strategy, set-up and delivery of capital programs.Your track record will have seen you leading teams and providing advice on complex projects across electricity sector. Technical understanding of Project Management, Commercial Management and Project Controls.Candidates should expect, and be able to, travel throughout the US, to support the growth of our Clean Energy activity. Key Objectives:Working with our global leadership and in country teams determine and implement a sector strategy. Increase market share and influence, within the Transmission and Clean Energy sector in the US. Develop and secure relationships with key clients across the Transmission and Clean Energy sectors. Build and lead a team – including responsibility for P&L. Enable and achieve financial targets and continued growth within target markets. To ensure that the Clean Energy team in the US is effectively structured, engaged and led. Key Requirements Of The Role:To be an inspirational leader and strategic thinker. To build strong relationships with clients and cross-functional team members.To build teams To secure business development opportunities with existing and new clients, including cross-selling opportunities, and to generate new business to achieve the Vision 2025 goal for the US, and specifically the Clean Energy sector. To lead pursuits and tenders – developing compelling propositions for the delivery of outcomes that drive improved performance To assure the delivery of our teams in Clean Energy To be part of our global Clean Energy team – a conduit for learning and sharing information in the business Set ambitious targets for Clean Energy in the US. Effectively manage risks and maximize commercial returns, applying business acumen. Inspire people to give their best and to challenge the norm to find better ways to achieve, by valuing and nurturing the diverse skills and perspectives of our people. Lead by example and not be averse to being hands-on in creation and delivery. Act as a team player and be highly visible within the business. QualificationsProfile and key competencies:You will be self-motivated, driven by the goal of establishing Turner & Townsend as the #1 project management and commercial consultancy for Clean Energy in the US.  As a Director, you will also be responsible for developing and delivering on a business plan to meet ambitious annual growth targets.You Will Have:Extensive experience working as a client and/or consultant in development and delivery of clean energy, ideally in Transmission and/or Renewables Experience using and/or selling program management, project controls, cost and commercial management in Clean Energy A broad understanding of the electricity value chain from generation, through grid and into supply Good understanding of regulatory and permitting requirements and industry trends A proven track record in business development and building teams, ideally in consultancy An established network within the power industry supply chain Excellent communication skills, both oral and written The ability to guide and lead internal teams, offering a strong point of focus for the business. Operated as a consultant and delivered major capital programs Qualifications:Degree qualified in construction and/or engineering Professional memberships desirable. This includes new-builds and retrofits to existing /operating facilities.The ideal candidate should have an excellent understanding of scheduling best practices, resource & cost loaded scheduling, overall construction project controls as well as the interpersonal skills to be able to work closely with the internal stakeholders of the project team on a daily basis.The Scheduler will take responsibility for end to end service delivery and to act as key, day to day client interface, ensuring that client objectives are met through the delivery of a value added service. title: Director, Clean Energy & Transmission
description: Company DescriptionTurner & Townsend’s is a global consultancy with over 11,000 employees operating in 125 offices across 48 countries. Increase market share and influence, within the Transmission and Clean Energy sector in the US. Develop and secure relationships with key clients across the Transmission and Clean Energy sectors. Effectively manage risks and maximize commercial returns, applying business acumen. Inspire people to give their best and to challenge the norm to find better ways to achieve, by valuing and nurturing the diverse skills and perspectives of our people. Lead by example and not be averse to being hands-on in creation and delivery. Act as a team player and be highly visible within the business. Reports status and variances. Crafts action plans to meet objectives, budget and schedule.Implement change management routines to assess change requests, make recommendations, secure client approvals, and issue change orders. Turner & Townsend is located throughout the United States where we support clients across all Real Estate, Natural Resources and Infrastructure.Our Purpose is making the difference: transforming performance for a green, inclusive, and productive world. This Purpose is grounded in the belief that we work in an industry that has the potential to transform lives, whether by helping to tackle the climate agenda or levelling up society through improved infrastructure.We specialize in major programs, program management, cost and commercial management, net zero and digital solutions. We support projects throughout the whole lifecycle.Job DescriptionOur global Clean Energy team works across renewables, energy transmission, carbon capture and nuclear power. Our ambition is to be the catalyst for the world’s energy transition.Due to the continued success and expansion of the Clean Energy & Decarbonisation business, we are interested in speaking with a Senior Consultant with a proven background in delivering projects and programs in the clean energy sector.Requirements:Experience and credibility in the electricity sector with an existing knowledge of Transmission & Distribution and Renewables. Experience in the development and delivery of Carbon Capture schemes is also desirable. You will have established relationships with, both national and international clients and understand the requirements for strategy, set-up and delivery of capital programs.Your track record will have seen you leading teams and providing advice on complex projects across electricity sector. Technical understanding of Project Management, Commercial Management and Project Controls.Candidates should expect, and be able to, travel throughout the US, to support the growth of our Clean Energy activity. Key Objectives:Working with our global leadership and in country teams determine and implement a sector strategy. Increase market share and influence, within the Transmission and Clean Energy sector in the US. Develop and secure relationships with key clients across the Transmission and Clean Energy sectors. Build and lead a team – including responsibility for P&L. Enable and achieve financial targets and continued growth within target markets. To ensure that the Clean Energy team in the US is effectively structured, engaged and led. Key Requirements Of The Role:To be an inspirational leader and strategic thinker. To build strong relationships with clients and cross-functional team members.To build teams To secure business development opportunities with existing and new clients, including cross-selling opportunities, and to generate new business to achieve the Vision 2025 goal for the US, and specifically the Clean Energy sector. To lead pursuits and tenders – developing compelling propositions for the delivery of outcomes that drive improved performance To assure the delivery of our teams in Clean Energy To be part of our global Clean Energy team – a conduit for learning and sharing information in the business Set ambitious targets for Clean Energy in the US. Effectively manage risks and maximize commercial returns, applying business acumen. Inspire people to give their best and to challenge the norm to find better ways to achieve, by valuing and nurturing the diverse skills and perspectives of our people. Lead by example and not be averse to being hands-on in creation and delivery. Act as a team player and be highly visible within the business. QualificationsProfile and key competencies:You will be self-motivated, driven by the goal of establishing Turner & Townsend as the #1 project management and commercial consultancy for Clean Energy in the US.  As a Director, you will also be responsible for developing and delivering on a business plan to meet ambitious annual growth targets.You Will Have:Extensive experience working as a client and/or consultant in development and delivery of clean energy, ideally in Transmission and/or Renewables Experience using and/or selling program management, project controls, cost and commercial management in Clean Energy A broad understanding of the electricity value chain from generation, through grid and into supply Good understanding of regulatory and permitting requirements and industry trends A proven track record in business development and building teams, ideally in consultancy An established network within the power industry supply chain Excellent communication skills, both oral and written The ability to guide and lead internal teams, offering a strong point of focus for the business. Operated as a consultant and delivered major capital programs Qualifications:Degree qualified in construction and/or engineering Professional memberships desirable. multi-project environments.Ensure that schedule related data from vendors, suppliers, engineering and construction contractors of actual projects is provided as feedback into the planning and scheduling systems.Implement Project Planning & Scheduling strategy, plans and procedures, reflecting both Company and contractor roles, responsibilities and expectations.Actively work with project presentations.Produce high level and 1, 3, 6 month look ahead from P6 for reporting.Perform probabilistic analysis on integrated schedules and contractor schedules.Actively monitor and communicate any possible project issues that could delay the schedule.Conduct the required project schedule analysis, critical path analysis and schedule risk analysis for the project as a whole.Analyze deviations from the baseline in the Project Master schedule highlighting bottlenecks / delays and propose corrective actions, and highlight the overall schedule impact of any variance / change order.QualificationsExperience working in mission critical environments is preferred including commissioning activities.Construction experience- i.e. “boots on the ground.” This is site-level
